meanings.definition: To install new wiring in (a building, machine, etc.)
meanings.sent1: I need to rewire the old house to make it safe.
meanings.sent2: The electrician will rewire the entire building next week.
meanings.sent3: Trying to rewire the toaster to play music was a silly idea.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to rewire the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The colorful illustrations helped me understand how to rewire the circuit.

meanings.definition: To reorganize or rethink (a system, process, etc.)
meanings.sent1: It's time to rewire our approach to solving this problem.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to rewire their marketing strategy for better results.
meanings.sent3: I tried to rewire my morning routine, but I ended up oversleeping.
meanings.sent4: Her words managed to rewire my perspective on the situation.
meanings.sent5: The workshop on productivity helped me rewire my work habits effectively.
